intro: Prionosciadium humile, commonly known as the slender cowplant, is a herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Prionosciadium humile is a low-growing plant that typically reaches heights of less than 30 centimeters.
